conclusion: The image shows three objects—a birdcage, a small sandal, and a club-like object—casting shadows on a wooden surface.
Shadow A is slightly to the right of the birdcage, shadow B is slightly to the left of the sandal, and shadow C is slightly to the right of the club.
The light source is likely above and slightly to the left of the center of the objects.
The light source moves to the right above the objects, meaning it remains at the same height but moves along the x-axis.
If the light moves right, the shadows will move left.
Shadow A will shift left, closer to the base of the birdcage.
Shadow B will shift further left relative to the sandal.
Shadow C will shift left, closer to the base of the club.
The size of a shadow depends on the angle of the light rays and the distance between the object and the surface.
The shadows are slightly stretched, indicating the light is at an angle.
As the light moves right, the angle of the light rays relative to each object changes, affecting shadow size.
Shadow A initially stretches, then shrinks as the light nears a position above the birdcage, and stretches again if the light moves further right.
Shadow B shrinks as the light approaches a position directly above the sandal, then stretches again as the light moves further right.
Shadow C follows a similar pattern to the birdcage—stretches, then shrinks as the light nears a position above the club, and stretches again.
The birdcage is on the left, the club is bottom-left, and the sandal is top-right.
The birdcage will see its shadow shift leftward sooner.
The sandal will see its shadow shrink the most if the light ends up directly above it.
The club’s behavior will be intermediate between the birdcage and sandal.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, and C move left and change size as the light source moves to the right.
